intro: Callianira, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Goodeniaceae. These plants are characterized by their striking, often blue or purple, ray flowers that resemble holly leaves. They are typically found in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in saline environments. Callianira species are known for their ability to tolerate drought and salt spray, making them well-suited for maritime climates. Their unique floral structure and adaptive traits make them an important part of coastal ecosystems.
